docs.lead_paragraph: The Department of Veterans Affairs faces a serious numbers problem — multiple in fact.

headline.main: VA Problems Mount as Missteps Continue

docs.lead_paragraph: Workers at Trump Taj Mahal have authorized a strike against the troubled Atlantic City casino as they await a federal appeals court ruling on whether the casino must restore health insurance and pension benefits that it scrapped last year.

headline.main: Union Authorizes Strike Against Trump Taj Mahal
headline.print_headline: Union Authorizes Strike Against Trump Taj Mahal

docs.snippet: Workers at Trump Taj Mahal have authorized a strike against the troubled Atlantic City casino as they await a federal appeals court ruling on whether the casino must restore health insurance and pension benefits that it scrapped last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bill Walker said he would unilaterally accept federal funds to cover more low-income residents under the program.

headline.main: Over Objections of Legislature, Alaska’s Governor Says He Will Expand Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Over Objections of Legislature, Alaska’s Governor Says He Will Expand Medicaid

docs.abstract: Alaska Gov Bill Walker announces plan to unilaterally expand Medicaid by accepting federal funds that will cover roughly 42,000 Alaskans projected to be eligible under expansion; move comes after state Legislature fails to expand coverage, option for every state under Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: Gov. Bill Walker said he would unilaterally accept federal funds to cover more low-income residents under the program.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group said on Thursday that its medical costs were about as expected during the second quarter, but analysts were disappointed.

headline.main: Largest U.S. Health Insurer Raises Profit Outlook for Year
headline.print_headline: Largest U.S. Health Insurer Raises Profit Outlook for Year

docs.abstract: UnitedHealth Group reports second-quarter profit that beats expectations; analysts are disappointed by ratio of medical costs to premiums, which is higher than was expected.
docs.snippet: UnitedHealth Group said on Thursday that its medical costs were about as expected during the second quarter, but analysts were disappointed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state’s unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent in June; the city’s fell to 6.1 percent, higher than the national rate in part because job seekers have been flooding into New York.

headline.main: Unemployment Rates in New York City and State Fall to Seven-Year Lows
headline.print_headline: State and City Unemployment Rates Fall to Seven-Year Lows

docs.abstract: New York State Labor Dept reports New York City unemployment rate fell to 6.1 percent in June, from 6.4 percent in May; says state's unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent from 5.7 percent in May; levels are lowest since 2008.
docs.snippet: The state’s unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent in June; the city’s fell to 6.1 percent, higher than the national rate in part because job seekers have been flooding into New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uber is part of the 2016 presidential debate, with the responsibilities of employers, the virtues of technology and the necessity of workplace regulation at issue.

headline.main: Candidates Will Hail a Ride, but Not Necessarily the Uber Labor Model
headline.print_headline: Uber’s Much More Than Just a Ride Service in This Presidential Race

docs.abstract: Ride service Uber has become unanticipated surrogate for both Democratic and Republican presidential hopefuls; after leading era of on-demand economy, Uber has taken spotlight in debate between liberals and conservatives over future of work, obligations of business owners and necessity of workplace regulation.
docs.snippet: Uber is part of the 2016 presidential debate, with the responsibilities of employers, the virtues of technology and the necessity of workplace regulation at issue.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from San Francisco, and Michael Barbaro from New York. Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ASHLEY PARKER

docs.lead_paragraph: The move comes as a rival bidder, Exor, continues to press investors to vote against the Axis Capital deal.

headline.main: PartnerRe and Axis Capital Unveil Sweetened Terms for Merger

docs.abstract: DealBook Online; PartnerRe and Axis Capital Holdings announce agreement to sweeten terms of their merger after Exor pressed investors to vote against deal and accept its offer for PartnerRe.
docs.snippet: The move comes as a rival bidder, Exor, continues to press investors to vote against the Axis Capital deal.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo signed into law on Thursday pay and health protections for the state's nail salon workers, comprised largely of Asian and Latino immigrants, his office announced.

headline.print_headline: New York Governor Signs Emergency Nail Salon Worker Law

docs.snippet: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo signed into law on Thursday pay and health protections for the state's nail salon workers, comprised largely of Asian and Latino immigrants, his office announced.

docs.lead_paragraph: It wasn't quite hipster Jeb Bush who arrived at a San Francisco startup— via ride-share service Uber— but the Republican presidential contender did his best Thursday to show he's not part of what he called the ho-hum stagnation of Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senior Democrats pushed back Thursday against an undercover government probe of President Barack Obama's health care law, saying it didn't uncover any real fraud.

headline.print_headline: Democrats Decry Undercover Probe of HealthCare.gov
